BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TValue for the Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect<TValue, TItem> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: TItem
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TItem for the Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect<TValue, TItem> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the id of the MultiSelect component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the component allows the user to interact with it.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.</para>
            <para>If enabled,  the `Value` state will be persisted.</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Value</term>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the content that has to be passed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueExpression
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the expression for defining the value of the bound.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowCustomValue
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Allows user to add a
            Custom value the value which is not present in the suggestion list.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableVirtualization
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The Virtual Scrolling feature is used to display a large amount of data that you require without buffering the entire load of a huge database records in the DropDowns, that is, when scrolling, the datamanager request is sent to fetch some amount of data from the server dynamically.
            To achieve this scenario with DropDowns, set the EnableVirtualization to true.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ItemsCount
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The data can be fetched in popup based on ItemsCount, when enabled the EnableVirtualization.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowFiltering
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>To enable the filtering option in this component.</para>
            <para>Filter action performs when type in search box and collect the matched item through `Filtering` event.</para>
            <para>If searching character does not match, `NoRecordsTemplate` property value will be shown.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableChangeOnBlur
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>By default, the MultiSelect component fires the Change event while focus out the component.</para>
            <para>If you want to fires the Change event on every value selection and remove, then disable the EnabledChangeOnBlur property.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableCloseOnSelect
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Based on the property, when item get select popup visibility state will changed.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the MultiSelect. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a MultiSelect.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: DelimiterChar
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the delimiter character for 'default' and 'delimiter' visibility modes.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableGroupCheckBox
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Specifies a boolean value that indicates the whether the grouped list items are
            allowed to check by checking the group header in checkbox mode.</para>
            <para>By default, there is no checkbox provided for group headers.</para>
            <para>This property allows you to render checkbox for group headers and to select
            all the grouped items at once.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableSelectionOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Reorder the selected items in popup visibility state.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterBarPlaceholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Accepts the value to be displayed as a watermark text on the filter bar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the floating label behavior of the MultiSelect that the placeholder text floats above the MultiSelect based on the following values.
            <para>Possible values are: </para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Never</term>
            <description>Never floats the label in the MultiSelect when the placeholder is available.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Always</term>
            <description>The floating label always floats above the MultiSelect.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Auto</term>
            <description>The floating label floats above the MultiSelect after focusing it or when enters the value in it.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: HideSelectedItem
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Hides the selected item from the list item.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
            <para>If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: InputAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
            <para>If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: MaximumSelectionLength
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Sets limitation to the value selection.</para>
            <para>Based on the limitation, list selection will be prevented.</para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Mode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            configures visibility mode for component interaction.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OpenOnClick
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Whether to automatically open the popup when the control is clicked.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Placeholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user focuses or enter a value in MultiSelect. The property is depending on the FloatLabelType property.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupHeight
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the height of the popup list. By default, it renders based on its list item.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupWidth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the width of the popup list and percentage values has calculated based on input width.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Readonly
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the boolean value whether the MultiSelect allows the user to change the value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: SelectAllText
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the selectAllText to be displayed on the component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowClearButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enables close icon with the each selected item.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowDropDownIcon
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Allows you to either show or hide the DropDown button on the component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowSelectAll
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Allows you to either show or hide the selectAll option on the component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Text
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Selects the list item which maps the data `Text` field in the component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: UnSelectAllText
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the UnSelectAllText to be displayed on the component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Selects the list item which maps the data `Value` field in the component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the callback to trigger when the value changes.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Accepts the template design and assigns it to the selected list item in the input element of the component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FooterTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Accepts the template design and assigns it to the footer container of the popup list.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: HeaderTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Accepts the template design and assigns it to the header container of the popup list.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the width of the component. By default, it sizes based on its parent.
            container dimension.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: TabIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the tab order of the DropDownList component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnChange
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content of input has changed and gets focus-out.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnKeyUp
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content of input has changed and gets focus-out.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnInput
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers each time when the value of input has changed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnBlur
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input loses the focus.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Documentation:

BoundAttributes.Name: ItemTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template design and assigns it to each list item present in the popup.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: GroupTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template design and assigns it to the group headers present in the popup list.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: NoRecordsTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template design and assigns it to popup list of component, when no data is available on the component.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ActionFailureTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template and assigns it to the popup list content of the component, when the data fetch request from the remote server fails.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: SortOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Specifies the `SortOrder` to sort the data source.</para>
            <para>The available type of sort orders are.</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>None</term>
            <description>The data source is not sorting.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Ascending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with ascending order.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Descending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with descending order.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The order of sorting the list items. The default value is <c>SortOrder.None</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: DataSource
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Gets or sets the list items either through local or remote service and binds it to the component.</para>
            <para>It can be an array of JSON Objects or an instance of `DataManager`.</para>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            Binding data to the popup element. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Query
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the external `Query` that execute along with data processing.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            Query value to be used for data fetching. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets which filter type, the component needs to be considered on search action.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The filter type specifed for searching the list items. The default value is <c>FilterType.StartsWith</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IgnoreCase
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether case-sensitivity is enabled or disabled when searching for suggestions.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>false</c>, consider the `case-sensitive` on performing the search to find suggestions. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IgnoreAccent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether diacritic characters or accents are ignored.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, ignores the diacritic characters or accents when filtering. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ZIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the z-index value of the component popup element.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The ZIndex value for the popup element.The default value is <c>1000</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Context
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the parameter name for all child content expressions.

BoundAttributes.Name: SortOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Specifies the `SortOrder` to sort the data source.</para>
            <para>The available type of sort orders are.</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>None</term>
            <description>The data source is not sorting.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Ascending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with ascending order.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Descending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with descending order.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The order of sorting the list items. The default value is <c>SortOrder.None</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: DataSource
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Gets or sets the list items either through local or remote service and binds it to the component.</para>
            <para>It can be an array of JSON Objects or an instance of `DataManager`.</para>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            Binding data to the popup element. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Query
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the external `Query` that execute along with data processing.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            Query value to be used for data fetching. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets which filter type, the component needs to be considered on search action.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The filter type specifed for searching the list items. The default value is <c>FilterType.StartsWith</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IgnoreCase
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether case-sensitivity is enabled or disabled when searching for suggestions.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>false</c>, consider the `case-sensitive` on performing the search to find suggestions. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IgnoreAccent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether diacritic characters or accents are ignored.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, ignores the diacritic characters or accents when filtering. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ZIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the z-index value of the component popup element.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The ZIndex value for the popup element.The default value is <c>1000</c>.
            </value>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The DataManager is a data management component used for performing data operations in applications.
            It acts as an abstraction for using local data source - IEnumerable and remote data source - web services returning JSON or oData.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: HttpClientInstance
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the HttpClient instance to be used  by DataManager.
            </summary>
            <remarks>Use HttpClientInstance property to inject named HttpClient into DataManager.</remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Url
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the endpoint URL. DataManager requests this URL when data is needed.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AdaptorInstance
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the custom adaptor class type. DataManager uses this type value to instantiate custom adaptor class.
            </summary>
            <remarks>DataManager uses Activator.CreateInstance method to create custom adaptor instance.
            Injecting services into custom adaptor class, is not supported while using this approach.
            To inject and use services, provide custom adaptor as a Blazor component by extending DataAdaptor class.</remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Adaptor
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the data adaptor to be used by DataManager.
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>BlazorAdaptor</term>
            <description>Default. BlazorAdaptor is used to process Enumerable data. It contains methods to process the given collection based on the queries.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>ODataAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            OData Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData services.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>ODataV4Adaptor</term>
            <description>
            ODatav4 Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData v4 services
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>WebApiAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            WebApi Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from WebApi services.
            This adaptor is targeted to interact with Web API created using OData endpoint, it is extended from ODataAdaptor
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>UrlAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            URL Adaptor is used when you are required to interact with all kind of remote services to retrieve data.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>RemoteSaveAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            Remote Save Adaptor is used for binding JSON data.
            It interacts with remote services only for CRUD operations.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>CustomAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            CustomAdaptor specifies that own data query and manipulation logic has been provided using custom adaptor component
            extended from DataAdaptor class.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>JsonAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            JsonAdaptor is used to process JSON data at the client side. It contains methods to process the given JSON data based on the queries.
            </description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: DataAdaptor
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Holds adaptor instance.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: InsertUrl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the insert URL.
            </summary>
            <remarks>Applicable for remote adaptors.
            When Insert method is called, request will be made to InsertUrl.
            If InsertUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.</remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: RemoveUrl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the remove URL.
            </summary>
            <remarks>Applicable for remote adaptors.
            When Remove method is called, request will be made to RemoveUrl.
            If RemoveUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.</remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: UpdateUrl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the update URL.
            </summary>
            <remarks>Applicable for remote adaptors.
            When Update method is called, request will be made to UpdateUrl.
            If UpdateUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.</remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: CrudUrl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the CRUD URL.
            </summary>
            <remarks>Applicable for remote adaptors.
            When Insert, Remove or Update method is called, request will be made to CrudUrl.
            If CrudUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.</remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: BatchUrl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the batch url.
            </summary>
            <remarks>Applicable for remote adaptors.
            When SaveChanges method is called, request will be made to BatchUrl.
            If BatchUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.</remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Json
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the IEnumerable collection. This data could be queried and manipulated.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Headers
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the key/value pair of headers.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Use Headers to add any custom headers to the request made by DataManager.
            Users can also send authentication bearer token using Headers property.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Accept
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the accept type.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Data
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the IEnumerale data.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: TimeTillExpiration
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the time limit to clear the cached data.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CachingPageSize
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the caching page size.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableCaching
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enables data caching.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: RequestType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the request type for sending data fetching.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: Key
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the primary key value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CrossDomain
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            When true, then indicates that the request is a cross-domain request.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Jsonp
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the jsonp request.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: DataType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the data type.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Offline
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enables offline mode in datamanager.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Applicable for remote data source. If offline is true then initial request will be made to fetch
            data. Further actions will be handled at the in-memory data and no more request will be made to the service.
            Cached data is stored in the JSON property.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: RequiresFormat
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sepcifies requires format.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Defines the child content.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: AdaptorInstance
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the custom adaptor class type. DataManager uses this type value to instantiate custom adaptor class.
            </summary>
            <remarks>DataManager uses Activator.CreateInstance method to create custom adaptor instance.
            Injecting services into custom adaptor class, is not supported while using this approach.
            To inject and use services, provide custom adaptor as a Blazor component by extending DataAdaptor class.</remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Adaptor
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the data adaptor to be used by DataManager.
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>BlazorAdaptor</term>
            <description>Default. BlazorAdaptor is used to process Enumerable data. It contains methods to process the given collection based on the queries.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>ODataAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            OData Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData services.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>ODataV4Adaptor</term>
            <description>
            ODatav4 Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData v4 services
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>WebApiAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            WebApi Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from WebApi services.
            This adaptor is targeted to interact with Web API created using OData endpoint, it is extended from ODataAdaptor
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>UrlAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            URL Adaptor is used when you are required to interact with all kind of remote services to retrieve data.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>RemoteSaveAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            Remote Save Adaptor is used for binding JSON data.
            It interacts with remote services only for CRUD operations.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>CustomAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            CustomAdaptor specifies that own data query and manipulation logic has been provided using custom adaptor component
            extended from DataAdaptor class.
            </description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>JsonAdaptor</term>
            <description>
            JsonAdaptor is used to process JSON data at the client side. It contains methods to process the given JSON data based on the queries.
            </description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Name
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
             Optionally gives a name to the provided value. Descendant components
             will be able to receive the value by specifying this name.
            
             If no name is specified, then descendant components will receive the
             value based the type of value they are requesting.
             </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsFixed
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            If true, indicates that <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.CascadingValue`1.Value" /> will not change. This is a
            performance optimization that allows the framework to skip setting up
            change notifications. Set this flag only if you will not change
            <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.CascadingValue`1.Value" /> during the component's lifetime.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery
TagHelpers.Documentation: The Blazor Media Query component allows developers to create responsive layouts. The component tracks changes in the browser size and notifies when the browser size matches the specified media query. The class is used to store information about each media query breakpoint, including the Breakpoint name and the MediaQuery itself. The property returns the Breakpoint of the MediaBreakpoint in the MediaBreakpoints collection that matches the current browser size. This allows developers to easily create responsive layouts that adapt to different screen sizes and device types. Loading... } else { @if(activeBreakpoint == "Small") { } else { } } @code { private string activeBreakpoint; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ActiveBreakpoint
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets the of the in collection that matches with the current browser size. Based on the ActiveBreakpoint, developers can easily create responsive layouts that adapt to different screen sizes and device types. A string value that represents the of the in collection that matches with the browser size. The default value is null.

BoundAttributes.Name: MediaBreakpoints
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the collection of <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint" /> that contains the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.Breakpoint" /> and <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.MediaQuery" />.
            <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.ActiveBreakpoint" /> is set when a <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.MediaQuery" /> matches with the current browser size from this collection.
            </summary>
            <value>
            A collection of <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint" /> that contains the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.Breakpoint" /> and <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.MediaQuery" />.
            The defaul value is empty collection.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.MediaBreakpoints" /> is not specified, <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery" /> will use built-in collection of <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint" /> that contains <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.Small" />, <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.Medium" /> and <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.Large" /> media queries.
            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Button Group Button component is creates a button component which is a graphical user interface that helps to triggers an event on its click action. 
            It can contain a text, an icon, svg or both. 
            </summary> 
            <remarks> 
            The button content is either by specifying <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton.Content" /> property or by specifying content within <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton" /> tag directive. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<exclude />
            <summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the child content for the button including HTML element. If the child content is not specified, button is rendered using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton.Content" /> property. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            The child content which is specified within <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton" /> tag directive is either a string or HTML Element. The string content is also specified using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton.Content" /> property. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the CSS class string to customize the appearance of button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance of button. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconCss
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the CSS class string to include an icon or image for the button.  
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to include an icon or image for the button. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Disabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets whether the button is disabled or not. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the button component is disabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Selected
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets whether the component is selected or not. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the component is selected. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Name
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the name of the component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            The <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton.Name" /> property is used to set the name attribute of input element. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the value of the component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            The <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton.Value" /> property is used to set the value attribute of input element. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Content
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the content of button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            Set child content within <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton" /> tag directive, to render as HTML content. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsToggle
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets whether the toggle option is enabled for button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the toggle option is enabled for button component. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsPrimary
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets whether the primary style is enabled for button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the primary style is enabled for button component. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates how to display icons in the button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.ButtonGroupButton.IconPosition" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.IconPosition.Left" /> 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Left</c>, the icon will be placed left to the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Right</c>, the icon will be placed right to the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Top</c>, the icon will be placed above the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Bottom</c>, the icon will be placed below the content of the button. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes that will applied to the button container element. Additional attributes can be added by specifying as inline attributes or by specifying @attributes directive. In the below code example, button width has been specified as style attribute in tag directive. Left Center Right ]]>

            <remarks>

            If the <c>Mode</c> is <c>Multiple</c>, it allows multiple selection in the button group component. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates how to display icons in the dropdown button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.SfDropDownButton.IconPosition" /> enumeration. The default value is <c>Left</c>.
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Left</c>, the icon will be placed left to the content of the dropdown button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Right</c>, the icon will be placed right to the content of the dropdown button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Top</c>, the icon will be placed above the content of the dropdown button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Bottom</c>, the icon will be placed below the content of the dropdown button. 
            </remarks>

            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Duration
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the duration of the animation done in the progress button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a double value to set the duration of the animation of progress button. The default value is <c>400</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Easing
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the animation timing function of the progress button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the progress UI is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Effect
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets the animation effect of the progress button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.AnimationEffect" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.AnimationEffect.None" /> 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>AnimationEffect</c> is <c>SlideLeft</c>, the content will be moved with slide left  animation. 
            If the <c>AnimationEffect</c> is <c>SlideRight</c>, the content will be moved with slide right animation. 
            If the <c>AnimationEffect</c> is <c>SlideUp</c>, the content will be moved with slide up animation. 
            If the <c>AnimationEffect</c> is <c>SlideDown</c>, the content will be moved with slide down animation. 
            If the <c>AnimationEffect</c> is <c>ZoomIn</c>, the content will be moved with zoom in  animation. 
            If the <c>AnimationEffect</c> is <c>ZoomOut</c>, the content will be moved with zoom out  animation 
            </remarks>

            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Bottom</c>, the icon will be placed below the content of the split button component. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Items
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the action items with its properties which will be rendered as split button's secondary button.  
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a collection of <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.DropDownMenuItem" /> object. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>Items</c> property is not specified, the split button component's secondary button is populated using <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.DropDownMenuItems" /> and <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SplitButtons.DropDownMenuItem" /> tag directives. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a value that indicates the custom element as action items which will be rendered in split button popup. The template content. The default value is null. If the Items property and tag directive is not specified, the dropdown button is populated using . In the below code example, a DropDownButton component rendered with ListView component as . @code { public List Data = new List{ new ListData{ Class = "data", Text = "Print", Id = "data1" }, new ListData{ Class = "data", Text = "Save As", Id = "data2" }, new ListData{ Class = "data", Text = "Update Folder", Id = "data3" }, new ListData{ Class = "data", Text = "Reply", Id = "data4" } }; public class ListData { public string Text { get; set; } public string Id { get; set; } public string Class { get; set; } } } ]]>

Additional attributes can be added by specifying as inline attributes or by specifying @attributes directive. In the below code example, split button width has been specified as style attribute in tag directive. ]]>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Authorization.AuthorizeRouteView
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
             Combines the behaviors of <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Authorization.AuthorizeView" /> and <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.RouteView" />,
             so that it displays the page matching the specified route but only if the user
             is authorized to see it.
            
             Additionally, this component supplies a cascading parameter of type <see cref="T:System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1" />,
             which makes the user's current authentication state available to descendants.
             </summary>

            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Disabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the color picker. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the button component is disabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableOpacity
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the opacity slider. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the opacity slider is enabled. The default value is <c>true</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to persist component's state between page reloads. When set to <c>true</c>, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfColorPicker.Value" /> property is persisted. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the component's state persistence is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            Component's <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfColorPicker.Value" /> property will be stored in browser local storage to persist component's state when page reloads. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>

            </summary> 
            <value>

            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Inline
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable to disable the inlide mode color picker. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the color picker component is rendered as inline. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Mode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the mode of color picker to be rendered. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.ColorPickerMode" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.ColorPickerMode.Picker" /> 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>ColorPickerMode</c> is <c>Picker</c>, the color picker is rendered as a picker. 
            If the <c>ColorPickerMode</c> is <c>Palette</c>, the color picker is rendered as a palette. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ModeSwitcher
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>

            </summary>

            </value>

<summary>

            </remarks>

            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the floating label behavior of the SfMaskedTextBox that the placeholder text floats above the SfMaskedTextBox based on the following values.
            <para>Possible values are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Never</term>
            <description>Never floats the label in the SfMaskedTextBox when the placeholder is available.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Always</term>
            <description>The floating label always floats above the SfMaskedTextBox.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Auto</term>
            <description>The floating label floats above the SfMaskedTextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the floating label behavior of the SfMaskedTextBox that the placeholder text floats above the SfMaskedTextBox based on the following values.
            <para>Possible values are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Never</term>
            <description>Never floats the label in the SfMaskedTextBox when the placeholder is available.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Always</term>
            <description>The floating label always floats above the SfMaskedTextBox.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Auto</term>
            <description>The floating label floats above the SfMaskedTextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType

<summary>
            Specifies the floating label behavior of the TextBox that the placeholder text floats above the TextBox based on the following values.
            <para>Possible values are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Never</term>
            <description>Never floats the label in the TextBox when the placeholder is available.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Always</term>
            <description>The floating label always floats above the TextBox.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Auto</term>
            <description>The floating label floats above the TextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

<summary>
            Specifies a value that indicates whether the NumericTextBox component allows the value for the specified range.
            <para>True - the input value will be restricted between the min and max range. The typed value gets modified to fit the range on a focused out state.</para>
            <para>Else, it allows any value even out of range value, at that time of wrong value entered, the error class will be added to the component to highlight the error.</para>

This property is used to validate the form on typing into the input and updating the model value. The ValueChange event will be fired after the component lost its focus.

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowReset
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to show or hide the reset button in a rating component.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, the reset button will be visible to the user and they will be able to click it to reset the rating value to its default. 
            The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

            </summary>

            One or more CSS classes to customize the appearance of the rating component, such as by changing its colors, fonts, sizes, or other visual aspects.
            The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Disabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that specifies whether a rating component is enabled or disabled.
            A disabled rating component may have a different visual appearance than an enabled one.
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, the rating component will be disabled and the user will not be able to interact with it. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a template that defines the appearance of each un-rated item in a rating component. Rating with empty template. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableAnimation
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to add animation (to provide visual feedback to the user) when an item in a rating component is hovered.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, an animation will be added when the user hovers their cursor over an item in the rating component.
            The default value is <c>true</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableSingleSelection
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to select all the items before the selected item should be in selected state in a rating component.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, only the selected item will be in the selected state, and all other items will be un-selected.
            <c>false</c>, all items before the selected one will be in the selected state.
            The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a template that defines the appearance of each rated item in a rating component.             </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ItemsCount
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that specifies the number of items (symbols) in rating component.
            The rating component typically consists of a number of items, such as stars or other symbols, that represent the rating value. 
            </summary>
            <value>
            An int that specifies the number of items (symbols) displayed in rating component
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: LabelPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets the the position of the label in rating component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.LabelPosition" /> enumeration that specifies the position of the label. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.LabelPosition.Right" />.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            You can use this property to customize the position of the label within the rating component to suit the needs of your application. 
            For example, you can set the <c>LabelPosition</c> property to ,<c>Top</c> to position the label at the top center of the rating component, 
            or set it to <c>Left</c> to position the label at the left side of the component.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: LabelTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a template that used as label over default label of the rating. The current value of rating passed as context to build the content. The template content. The default value is null. Rating with label template. @context Out Of 5 ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Min
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets the value that specifies minimum rating that a user can select.
            </summary>
            <value>
            By default, the <c>Min</c> property is set to 0, which means that the minimum possible rating is 0.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            You can use the <c>Min</c> property to customize the minimum possible rating in the <c>SfRating</c> component. 
            For example, if you want to allow users to provide ratings from 1 to 5, you can set the <c>Min</c> property to 1 and <c>ItemsCount</c> to 5.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Precision
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the precision type of the rating which used to component the granularity of the rating, allowing users to provide ratings with varying levels of precision. One of the enumeration that specifies the precision type. The default value is . The Precision property can be set to one of the following values: * Full: The rating is increased in whole number increments. For example, if the current rating is 3, the next possible ratings are 4, 5, and so on. * Half: The rating is increased in increments of 0.5 (half). For example, if the current rating is 3.5, the next possible ratings are 4, 4.5, 5, and so on. * Quarter: The rating is increased in increments of 0.25 (quarter). For example, if the current rating is 3.75, the next possible ratings are 4, 4.25, 4.5, and so on. * Exact: The rating is increased in increments of 0.1. For example, if the current rating is 3.9, the next possible ratings are 4, 4.1, 4.2, and so on.

BoundAttributes.Name: ReadOnly
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a boolean value that specifies whether the read-only mode is enabled for a rating component, 
            which means that the user will be able to interact with it and change the rating value. 
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>,the rating component will be in read-only mode, which means that the user will not be able to interact with it and change the rating value. 
            The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowLabel
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to display a label that shows the current value of a rating.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, a label will be displayed that shows the current value of the rating; otherwise false. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowTooltip
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that defines whether to show tooltip for the items.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, show tooltip for the items. The default value is <c>true</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: TooltipTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets a template that used as tooltip content over default tooltip content of the rating. The current value of rating passed as context to build the content. The template content. The default value is null. Rating with tooltip template.
@context Star
 ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Value
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the current rating value which used to display and update the rating selected by the user. Based on , users can select ratings with varying levels of precision The Value property is a decimal value that ranges from the to the , as specified by the Min and ItemsCount properties of the rating. You can use the Value property to initialize the rating component with a specific rating value, or to get the current rating value selected by the user. For example, if you want to initialize the rating component with a rating of 3.5, you can set the Value property to 3.5.

            <value>

BoundAttributes.Name: StrokeColor
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the stroke color of the signature. The color of the signature stroke that accepts hex value, rgb and text (like red). The default value is "#000000".

BoundAttributes.Name: MinStrokeWidth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the minimum stroke width for signature. 
            The <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature" /> component calculates stroke width based on <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature.Velocity" />, <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature.MinStrokeWidth" /> and <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature.MaxStrokeWidth" />.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The minimum width of stroke. The default value is <c>0.5</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: MaxStrokeWidth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the maximum stroke width for signature.
            The <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature" /> component calculates stroke width based on <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature.Velocity" />, <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature.MinStrokeWidth" /> and <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature.MaxStrokeWidth" />.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The maximum width of stroke. The default value is <c>2.0</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Velocity
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the velocity to calculate the stroke thickness based on the pressure of the contact on the digitizer surface.
            The Signature component calculates stroke thickness based on <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature.Velocity" />, <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature.MinStrokeWidth" /> and <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature.MaxStrokeWidth" />.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The velocity to calculate the stroke thickness based on the pressure of the contact on the digitizer surface. The default value is <c>0.7</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to persist component's state between page reloads.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the component's state persistence is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            Component's property will be stored in browser local storage to persist component's state when page reloads.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised while saving the signature. The file name and the file type(PNG, JPEG, SVG) can be changed using and . The event callback is raised only for the keyboard action (Ctrl + S). @code { private void beforesavefunc(SignatureSaveEventArgs args) { args.fileType = "SignatureFileType.Jpeg"; } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Created
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when component rendering is completed. You can load the pre-drawn signature when the signature component is created. In the below code example, the pre-drawn signature is loaded using Created event. @code { private void Created() { var sign = ""; // Base 64 or URL of the pre-drawn signature signature.LoadAsync(sign); } } ]]> Renders the base 64 string as signature on component. A Task that completes when the component has finished the loading of base 64 string. In the below code example, the pre-drawn signature is loaded using Created event. @code { private void Created() { var sign = ""; // Base 64 or URL of the pre-drawn signature signature.LoadAsync(sign, 400, 400); } } ]]>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSignature
TagHelpers.Documentation: Signature allows user to draw smooth signatures as vector outline of strokes using variable width Bézier curve interpolation. It allows to save signature as image. You can use your finger, pen, or mouse on a tablet, touchscreen, etc., to draw your own signature on this Signature component. Signature is a user interface to draw the signature or text. It supports stroke color, background color and image. In the below code example, a basic Signature initialized with tag directive. ]]>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSlider<TValue>
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            Partial class SfSlider.
            </summary>
            <typeparam name="TValue">Generic type parameter.</typeparam>.
            <summary>
            The Slider component allows the user to select a value or range of values
            in-between the min and max range, by dragging the handle over the slider bar.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            Partial class SfSlider.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            Specifies the partial class SfSlider.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            Specifies the partial class SfSlider.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: TValue
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TValue for the Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSlider<TValue> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets id attribute for the slider element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the ChildContent.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueExpression
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the expression for defining the value of the bound.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the custom classes to be added to the element used to customize the slider.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CustomValues
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies an array of slider values in number or string type.
            The min and max step values are not considered.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableAnimation
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enables/Disables the animation for slider movement.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enables or disables the slider.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Max
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the maximum value of the slider.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Min
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the minimum value of the slider.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Orientation
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
             Specifies whether to render the slider in vertical or horizontal orientation.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ReadOnly
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the render the slider in read-only mode to restrict any user interaction.
            The slider rendered with user defined values and can’t be interacted with user actions.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowButtons
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether to show or hide the increase/decrease buttons
            of Slider to change the slider value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Step
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the step value for each value change when the increase / decrease
             button is clicked or on arrow keys press or on dragging the thumb.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Type
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Defines the type of the Slider. The available options are:
              Default - Allows to a single value in the Slider.
              MinRange - Allows to select a single value in the Slider. It display’s a shadow from the start to the current value.
              Range - Allows to select a range of values in the Slider. It displays shadow in-between the selection range.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            It is used to denote the current value of the Slider.
            The value should be specified in array of number when render Slider type as range.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a callback of the bound value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the width of the Slider.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsImmediateValue
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the value need to be updated at the time of dragging slider handle.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SliderTooltip
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            This class is used to set a tooltip for slider component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the ChildContent.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            It is used to customize the Tooltip which accepts custom CSS class names that define
             specific user-defined styles and themes to be applied on the Tooltip element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Format
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            It is used to customize the Tooltip content to the desired format
             using internationalization or events (custom formatting).
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsVisible
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            It is used to show or hide the Tooltip of Slider Component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Placement
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            It is used to denote the position for the tooltip element in the Slider. The available options are:
              Before - Tooltip is shown in the top of the horizontal slider bar or at the left of the vertical slider bar.
              After - Tooltip is shown in the bottom of the horizontal slider bar or at the right of the vertical slider bar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowOn
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            It is used to determine the device mode to show the Tooltip.
            If it is in desktop, it will show the Tooltip content when hovering on the target element.
            If it is in touch device. It will show the Tooltip content when tap and holding on the target element.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfTextBox
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The TextBox is an input element that allows to get input from the user. It allows the user to edit or display the text value.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The TextBox is an input element that allows to get input from the user. It allows the user to edit or display the text value.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The TextBox is an input element that allows to get input from the user. It allows the user to edit or display the text value.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The TextBox is an input element that allows to get input from the user. It allows the user to edit or display the text value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Blur
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the TextBox has focus-out.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueChange
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content of TextBox has changed and gets focus-out.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Created
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the TextBox component is created.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Destroyed
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the TextBox component is destroyed.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Focus
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the TextBox gets focus.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Input
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers each time when the value of TextBox has changed.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Autocomplete
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether the browser is allowed to automatically enter or select a value for the TextBox.
            <para>By default, autocomplete is enabled for TextBox.</para>
            <para>Possible values are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>On</term>
            <description>Specifies that autocomplete is enabled</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Off</term>
            <description>Specifies that autocomplete is disabled.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the floating label behavior of the TextBox that the placeholder text floats above the TextBox based on the following values.
            <para>Possible values are:</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Never</term>
            <description>Never floats the label in the TextBox when the placeholder is available.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Always</term>
            <description>The floating label always floats above the TextBox.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Auto</term>
            <description>The floating label floats above the TextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Placeholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the boolean value whether the TextBox allows user to change the text.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Readonly
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the boolean value whether the TextBox allows user to change the text.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowClearButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the clear button is displayed in TextBox.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the width of the TextBox component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: TabIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the tab order of the TextBox component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Multiline
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a boolean value that enables or disables the multiline on the TextBox.
            The TextBox changes from a single line to multiline when enabling this multiline mode.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional html attributes such as styles, class, and more to the root element.
            If you configured both property and equivalent html attributes, then the component considers the property value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: InputAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
            If you configured both property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Type
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the behavior of the TextBox such as text, password, email, and more.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnChange
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content of input has changed and gets focus-out.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnInput
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers each time when the value of input has changed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnPaste
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content is paste into an input.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnBlur
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input has focus-out.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnFocus
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input gets focus.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the id of the TextBox component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the content of the TextBox.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the callback to trigger when the value changes.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueExpression
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the expression for defining the value of the bound.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the TextBox. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a TextBox.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable the persisting TextBox state between page reloads. If enabled, the `Value` state will be persisted.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable rendering component in the right to left direction.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the TextBox allows the user to interact with it.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValidateOnInput
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the component validates the input or not. true, If the ValidateOnInput is enabled for form validation, then the model value will be updated on entering the value to the input. otherwise, false.The default value is false. This property is used to validate the form on typing into the input and updating the model value. The ValueChange event will be fired after the component lost its focus.
